p.seg: An authoritative demarcation by an imperial procurator.

div.p: By the authority of the emperor Caesar, son of the divine Trajan Parthicus, grandson of the devine Nerva, Trajan Hadrian Augustus, father of the country, pontifex maximus, (holding the) tribunician power for the 21st time, consul 3 times, proconsul. Under the auspices of Lucius Aelius Caesar, son of the emperor, consul. Boundary markers placed between the Regienses and the Saltus Cu[---] through Gaius Petronius Celer, imperial procurator. In the year of the province: 98.
